grammarNote.title: Conditional: たら
grammarNote.explanation:
たら = past tense + ら. 海岸にいったら — if/when [we] go to the coast. 水が無くなったら — if the water runs out.

Sentence shape: [condition]たら + [result]. 海岸にいったらいいね — if we went to the coast, that'd be nice.

Notice たら is built from the past form you already know. いった (went) → いったら (if/when going).

Re-read and find every たら. What condition leads to what result?

vocabulary.meaning: to disappear, run out, be gone
